thread.title: Meow Meow leads the way as Sydney Festival 2016 program launches
thread.title_full: Meow Meow leads the way as Sydney Festival 2016 program launches | DailyTelegraph

author: Chris Hook
title: Meow Meow leads the way as Sydney Festival 2016 program launches
text:
IT’S A fine feline when Meow Meow comes to town and the purrfectly glamorous cabaret cat is back in action for the 2016 Sydney Festival.
Meow Meow’s Little Mermaid will premiere as part of next January’s festivities, the second instalment of a planned trilogy of Little shows that began with Meow Meow’s Little Match Girl in 2012.
The show takes the fairytale and runs with it in Meow Meow’s inimitably offbeat fashion. It co-stars Sydney Theatre Company stalwart Chris Ryan and includes songs by Amanda Palmer, Kate Miller-Heidke and Megan Washington.
Other highlights of the festival, which celebrates its 40th anniversary next year and begins on January 7, include The Flaming Lips headlining the free annual Summer Sounds In The Domain concert on January 9 and the Kate Miller-Heidke composed, Lally Katz-penned opera The Rabbits, based on the book by John Marsden and Shaun Tan, at Roslyn Packer Theatre from January 14-24.
The Parramatta instalment of Sydney Festival continues in 2016, albeit without the opening night party.
At the heart of it will be the free fairground with a difference, the Arquitectura de Feria, which will set up in Prince Alfred Square and features a range of rides using recycled materials including a hand-cranked ferris wheel using toilets as seats and a bicycle-powered carousel.
 The Square will also see the large-scale installation 1000 Bells take shape over the festival period, as 1000 ceramic bells are made on-site with workshops to help everyone get involved.
Riverside Theatres will host a range of acts, including the circus show La Verita, which hails from Switzerland and was inspired by a recently discovered work by Salvador Dali, painted on a curtain in the 1940s and used as a backdrop to this show, from January 8-17.
Sydney Festival, January 7-26, 2016; multipack tickets on sale today from 9am, single tickets on sale from October 26, 9am; 1300 856 876, sydneyfestival.org.au
